result.execSummary:
The defendant Joann Marie Kirkwood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **11/2/2015 - JOC amended to reflect Defendant solely responsible for restitution.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay restitution of $10,296.00 and restitution surcharge of $1,029.60.

**11/2/2015 - JOC amended to reflect Defendant solely responsible for restitution.

Obey all rules and conditions established by the Department of Corrections.

Comply with risk and needs assessments and any other screening tools identified by the Department of Corrections.

No consumption or possession of alcoholic beverages.  No entering bars, taverns or liquor stores.

No consumption or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and take exactly as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Not associate with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

Not be present where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

Obtain housing that meets with agent's approval.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and programming recommended.

Defendant to submit a DNA sample if not previously submitted; not required to pay DNA surcharge.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
